back: Serif - proportional and have serifs serifs are the decorations on the ends of the storkes Sans-Serif - proportional and do not have serifs Monospace - not proportional Cursive - attempt to emulate human handwriting Fancy - non really defined by any single characteristic other than our inability to classify them into the other font families
body { font-family: sans-serif;} h1,h2,h3,h4 { font-family: serif; }
h1 { font-family: TimesNR, serif; } h2 { font-family: 'New Century Schoolbook', Times, serif; }
absolute sizes: p.one { font-size: small; } p.two { font-size: large; }  relative sizes (relative to parent): p { font-size: medium; } strong { font-size: larger; }
computed values are inherited in CSS not percentages  percentages are cumulative
p { font-style: normal; } em { font-style: italic; }
h1 {font: italic 900 small-caps 30px Verdana, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;} h2 {font: bold normal italic 24px Verdana, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;}
